abstract: The iPad has many advantages over Kindle devices, and Amazon will need to make some significant changes, like cutting prices to redesigning software, if it hopes to compete.
snippet: The iPad has many advantages over Kindle devices, and Amazon will need to make some significant changes, like cutting prices to redesigning software, if it hopes to compete.
lead_paragraph: My colleague Brad Stone just blogged about why he thinks Apple’s iPad won’t kill the Kindle from Amazon.com.

headline.main: Three Reasons Why the iPad WILL Kill Amazon’s Kindle

abstract: Even as carriers struggle to meet the demands on their networks, they are encouraging the use of more sophisticated devices that hog bandwidth.
snippet: Even as carriers struggle to meet the demands on their networks, they are encouraging the use of more sophisticated devices that hog bandwidth.
lead_paragraph: Could Apple’s new iPad end up being too much of a good thing?

headline.main: As Devices Pull More Data, Patience May Be Required
headline.print_headline: As Devices Pull More Data, Patience May Be Required

abstract: A look at Twitter traffic before, during and after the iPad announcement.
snippet: A look at Twitter traffic before, during and after the iPad announcement.
lead_paragraph: The New York Times Research Labs created a real-time look at Twitter mentions related to the Apple announcement on Wednesday. At its peak, iPad-related messages were coming through Twitter at an average of 2,200 a minute, and maintained steadily at around 1,500 a minute hours after the briefing ended.

abstract: A quick video of the new Apple iPad in action.
snippet: A quick video of the new Apple iPad in action.
lead_paragraph: Brad Stone, who covered the introduction of the Apple iPad on Wednesday, got his hands on the device for a few minutes of play. The video shows just how fast the apps open.

headline.main: A Video Demonstration of the iPad

abstract: To many women, “iPad” suggests a product they regularly buy in the drugstore, not an expensive tablet computer.
snippet: To many women, “iPad” suggests a product they regularly buy in the drugstore, not an expensive tablet computer.
lead_paragraph: When Apple announced the name of its tablet computer today — the iPad — my mind immediately went to the feminine hygiene aisle of the drugstore. It turns out I wasn’t alone.

headline.main: The iPad’s Name Makes Some Women Cringe

abstract: Newspapers had a mixed reaction to the tablet, but most of the largest book publishers have signed on to provide e-book content.
snippet: Newspapers had a mixed reaction to the tablet, but most of the largest book publishers have signed on to provide e-book content.
lead_paragraph: With a few notable exceptions, the print world welcomed Apple’s new iPad on Wednesday, eager to tap into the 125 million customers who already have iTunes accounts and are predisposed to buying more content from Apple.

headline.main: Books on iPad Offer Publishers a Pricing Edge
headline.print_headline: Books on iPad Offer Publishers a Pricing Edge

abstract: Brad Stone, David Carr, John Markoff and David Pogue were among journalists for The New York Times writing about the announcement of the iPad. Here are excerpts from their observations.
snippet: Brad Stone, David Carr, John Markoff and David Pogue were among journalists for The New York Times writing about the announcement of the iPad. Here are excerpts from their observations.
lead_paragraph: Brad Stone, David Carr, John Markoff and David Pogue were among journalists for The New York Times writing about the announcement of the iPad tablet computer by Apple’s chief executive, Steven P. Jobs, on Wednesday. Here are excerpts from their observations, culled from the Bits blog, Pogue’s Posts and their individual Twitter streams.

headline.main: Highlights from the Bits Blog Coverage of the iPad Announcement
headline.print_headline: Highlights from the Bits Blog Coverage of the iPad Announcement

abstract: AT&T is offering a 250-MB and unlimited data plan with the Apple iPad? Which one might make more sense for you?
snippet: AT&T is offering a 250-MB and unlimited data plan with the Apple iPad? Which one might make more sense for you?
lead_paragraph: Update | 9:41 a.m. Clarified that iPod Touches do not use AT&T’s 3G wireless network.

headline.main: The iPad — To 3G or Not to 3G?

abstract: Some wild speculations of a guy who’s never even tried the iPad. Believe me, I’ll review it when I get one. But I like what I’m seeing.
snippet: Some wild speculations of a guy who’s never even tried the iPad. Believe me, I’ll review it when I get one. But I like what I’m seeing.
lead_paragraph: Today Apple finally unveiled its tablet computer, the iPad. Thus concludes Phase 1 of the standard Apple new-category roll-out: months of feverish speculation and hype online, without any official indication by Apple that the product even exists.

headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue

abstract: Canada investigates Facebook and its new privacy policy, an e-book pirate shares his story and Twitter users are advised to stop chattering about themselves.
snippet: Canada investigates Facebook and its new privacy policy, an e-book pirate shares his story and Twitter users are advised to stop chattering about themselves.
lead_paragraph: It’s Day 2 of Apple-mania, and technology writers everywhere are weighing in on the pros and cons of the iPad. But what else is happening online?
